record.title: MEASURE PLACED ON THE CALENDAR--S. 2128
record.narrative:
MEASURE PLACED ON THE CALENDAR--S. 2128 -- (Senate - October 03, 2007)

[Page: S12453]

speaking.paragraph: It is my understanding that S. 2128 is at the desk and due for a second reading.

record.chair: The clerk will read the bill by title for the second time.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:
A bill (S. 2128) to make the moratorium on Internet access taxes and multiple and discriminatory taxes on electronic commerce permanent.

speaking.paragraph: I object to any further proceedings with respect to this bill.

record.chair: Objection is heard. The bill will be placed on the calendar.
